Name: FileZilla
Description: FileZilla is a free, open-source FTP (File Transfer Protocol) client that supports FTP, FTPS, and SFTP. It is used for transferring files between a local computer and a remote server.
Author: TomJHKR

Name: WinSCP
Description: WinSCP is a free and open-source FTP, SFTP, and SCP client for Windows that allows secure file transfers between a local and a remote computer.
Author: TomJHKR

Name: Cyberduck
Description: Cyberduck is a free, open-source FTP, SFTP, WebDAV, and cloud storage browser for file transfers and management. It supports various protocols and cloud services, including Amazon S3 and Google Drive.

Name: SmartFTP

Name: BitTorrent
Description: BitTorrent is a free and paid peer-to-peer file sharing protocol and client software. It allows users to share and download files using the BitTorrent protocol, with features like bandwidth management, file prioritization, and remote access available in the paid version.
Author: TomJHKR

Network.Description: Known remote domains for BitTorrent connections

Name: µTorrent
Description: µTorrent (also known as uTorrent) is a free and paid BitTorrent client for peer-to-peer file sharing. It offers features like streaming, bandwidth management, and scheduling in the paid version, with the free version available for basic file sharing.
Author: TomJHKR

Network.Description: Known remote domains for µTorrent connections

Name: qBittorrent
Description: qBittorrent is a free, open-source BitTorrent client that offers a clean interface and a wide range of features for file sharing. It supports the BitTorrent protocol and allows for file prioritization, RSS feeds, and integrated search capabilities.
Author: TomJHKR

Network.Description: Known remote domains for qBittorrent connections

Name: FrostWire
Description: FrostWire is a free, open-source BitTorrent client and cloud downloader. It allows users to share files, download torrents, and stream media directly from the app. It also integrates with the FrostWire Cloud for downloading files directly from the internet.
Author: TomJHKR

Network.Description: Known remote domains for FrostWire connections

Name: eMule
Description: eMule is a free, open-source P2P (peer-to-peer) file-sharing client that is primarily used for downloading and sharing files over the eDonkey network and Kad network. It features support for various file types, powerful search capabilities, and a large user base.
Author: TomJHKR

Network.Description: Known remote domains for eMule connections

Name: ShareIt
Description: ShareIt is a free, cross-platform file-sharing application that allows users to transfer files, videos, music, and other types of media quickly between devices over a local network or using a Wi-Fi connection. It supports both Android and iOS devices, and it's known for its fast transfer speeds and user-friendly interface.
Author: TomJHKR

Name: Send Anywhere
Description: Send Anywhere is a free, cross-platform file transfer application that allows users to send files and folders securely across different devices. It provides options for both free and paid Pro versions with additional features such as higher transfer speeds, larger file sizes, and priority support.
Author: TomJHKR

Network.Description: Known remote domains for Send Anywhere connections

Name: Zapya
Description: Zapya is a free, cross-platform file transfer application that enables fast and wireless file sharing between devices. It supports Android, iOS, Windows, and MacOS, and can transfer files without the need for an internet connection by using Wi-Fi Direct. Zapya is known for its ability to share large files and multiple files simultaneously across different platforms.

Network.Description: Known remote domains for Zapya connections

Name: Feem
Description: Feem is a free and paid file transfer application that allows fast wireless file sharing between devices over a local network. It supports Android, iOS, Windows, and MacOS. Feem offers both a free version and a paid Pro version with additional features such as faster transfer speeds, larger file sizes, and ad-free experience.

Name: Nearby Share
Description: Nearby Share is a built-in file-sharing feature for Android and Windows devices that allows users to quickly send and receive files, photos, and links wirelessly. It uses Bluetooth, Wi-Fi, and peer-to-peer technology to enable fast and secure transfers without an internet connection.
Author: TomJHKR

PEMetadata.Description: File-sharing feature for Android and Windows devices

Name: Resilio Sync
Description: Resilio Sync is a file synchronization and sharing tool that uses peer-to-peer technology to sync files directly between devices. It allows for large file transfers without relying on cloud servers, making it ideal for secure, fast file sharing. The free version offers basic functionality, while the paid versions provide advanced features like selective sync, backup, and larger file size support.
Author: TomJHKR

Network.Description: Known domains for Resilio Sync connections

Name: MASV
Description: MASV is a paid service designed for fast and secure large file transfers. It allows users to send massive video files and other data efficiently, using a cloud-based platform that leverages accelerated file transfer protocols. With no file size limits and the ability to send files up to several terabytes, MASV is ideal for professional media creators and other industries requiring quick, reliable file sharing.
Author: TomJHKR

Network.Description: Known domains for MASV file transfer

Detections.Description: Detects potential network activity of MASV

Name: Smash
Description: Smash is a file transfer service that allows users to send large files quickly and easily. The free version has a size limit and a 14-day expiration for uploaded files, while the paid version provides additional features like unlimited file size, file retention, and priority support. Smash offers a simple, user-friendly interface and supports multiple file transfers simultaneously.
Author: TomJHKR

Network.Description: Known domains for Smash file transfer

Detections.Description: Detects potential network activity of Smash

Name: Filemail
Description: Filemail is a file transfer service designed for sending large files without the hassle of using cloud storage. The free version allows file transfers up to 50GB with size limits and has a 7-day expiration for files. The paid version offers unlimited file size, increased file retention, and additional features such as password protection, email tracking, and branded transfer pages.
Author: TomJHKR

Network.Description: Known domains for Filemail transfers

Detections.Description: Detects potential network activity of Filemail

Name: rsync
Description: rsync is a free, open-source file transfer and synchronization tool used to efficiently transfer and synchronize files between local and remote systems. It is commonly used for backups and mirroring and supports copying over SSH, minimizing data transfer by only copying changed parts of files.
Author: TomJHKR

Network.Description: Known remote domains for rsync synchronization

Detections.Description: Detects potential network activity of rsync

Name: scp (Secure Copy)
Description: scp is a free, command-line utility used for securely transferring files between hosts over a network. It uses SSH (Secure Shell) to provide encrypted transfer of files, ensuring confidentiality and integrity during the transfer process.
Author: TomJHKR

PEMetadata.Description: Secure file copy tool using SSH

Name: sftp (Secure File Transfer Protocol)

PEMetadata.Description: Secure file transfer protocol using SSH
